reviews.text: English speaking, and really helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, clean

reviews.text: Most important places are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Would not recommend this hotel
Good value for money
reviews.text: Lots of nice restaurants and cafés in the neighborhood.
The room and bathroom are cleaned everyday.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel I ever Stayed at for Service and poor accommodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only French channels on the TV, but who cares :)
reviews.title: Small rooms, but clean

likes.disliked: — Small room, even by European standards

reviews.title: Wouldn't go back
reviews.text: We had two rooms at this hotel for 4 nights in May 2006. One of the rooms was OK and the other was so small that you couldn't really move around in it all and there were no drawers to unpack, only a small closet for hanging. The smaller of the two rooms was room 35 and I would strongly recommend not to accept this room if you have 2 people(another reviewer has also mentioned this). It might be OK for 1. Room 33 was ok but there were splatters on the wall that looked like blood (we were hoping it was just red wine). The air conditioner in one room did not work and the other dripped all night. We told the staff about it and they were looked at but not fixed. Luckily for us the weather turned cool and they were not needed. The bathroom in room 35 is just so small that you cannot shower without the bathroom getting wet. A larger person would have a tough time. Room 33 had a tub with a shower head as well but no shower curtain. The rooms were inexpensive and because we spent so little time in them we managed. I did find myself not wanting to go back to the hotel except to sleep. The staff in the hotel was friendly, polite and helpful to us. I have no complaints about them. The lobby has a computer that can be used for no charge, which was a nice convenience. The location is good and there are several good restaurants close by, as well as a close metro stop. I think that your experience at this hotel depends so much on which room you get. Our was the worst but some of the ones that I could see when they were being cleaned look better. Also, the rooms are not very sound proof and the tiny little elevator sounds like it is groaning when it starts up and this can be heard at night as you lie in bed. My advise is to ask to see the room before you accept it and you may have a better stay then we did.

I have been reading the reviews on this site and wanted to add my 2 cents worth. My husband and I stayed here last year and it was literally one of the cheapest hotels with it's own facilities that we could find in one of the nicer parts of Paris as we were travelling on NZ dollars and didn't want to stay in a hostel or near a railway station. Due to the price we were not expecting much and to be honest, feel we got what we paid for. The rooms were basic and quite small so not so great with our huge packs and although we requested a double bed, we got two very small singles pushed together and yes the bathroom was tiny but at least it had a shower (none of these hand helds over the bath I have seen in other european hotels) and everything was very clean. We had lovely blue room with a large window which got the evening sun and had a view out over the street. The elevator was a laugh and after getting our bags up there we tended to use the stairs. A friend of ours was staying at an IBIS near a railway station and we visited her room which was slightly larger, the furnishings not as nice and she was paying more a night in a grotty, loud area than we were in lovely Saint Germain. Overall, Paris is not a cheap place to visit so if you are wanting a clean hotel in a great location and tend to spend most of your time out and making the most of your destination while only using the room only as somewhere to sleep and wash then this is great option. If you are one of those people who tend to spend a lot of time in your room or are travelling for a special occassion then you would be well advised to pay a bit more and get something more approriate.
reviews.title: Teeny Tiny Hotel but good for those not travelling on pounds or euros

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here in April 2006 for three nights -- never again. The receptionist was rude to the point of chatting away while we were waiting to check in, only to tell us to come back in an hour because our room wasn't ready....same thing happened again when we did come back.
reviews.title: Never again!
Horrible Hotel!!
reviews.text: The room was tiny -- even by European standards. We literally had to climb over the bed to get to the other side of the room. The wardrobe looked like the door had fallen off and was never replaced (ie - had hinges, yet no door). The wood on the desk was chipped - better not to have even had it in the room. Also, the walls are paper thin -- all conversations by our neighbors were easily overheard. There is no 'bar' aside from a tiny kitchen-looking area and the 'business centre' is essentially a laptop in the reception room.

One night we went out for dinner/drinks and didn't come back to the hotel until about 12:30 -- there wasn't a sole in the reception area -- however our room key (clearly labeled) was sitting right there out on the reception counter for anyone to come and steal....nice.
reviews.title: Great Location - TINY Bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an ideal location in the heart of the latin quarter but to be honest that is all it has going for it.Rooms are quite dingy and decor rather dull we did not even have a shower curtain which resulted in the floor getting pretty wet when showering,but on the plus side the air conditioning was great and with the weather being very hot it was needed.The staff were pleasant enough and can speak good english, but if we were to return to Paris we would look elsewhere to stay.But Paris itself is an amazing place we loved it and would probably go back.Eating out in the latin quarter is great pleanty choices,a three course meal will cost from about 10 euros.
reviews.title: Good location but hotel but needs to be upgraded to keep its 2 stars

reviews.text: We were lucky to visit on bastille day and during the world cup final the atmosphere was electric just a pity they had to loose
reviews.title: you get what you pay for
Perfect Paris Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel twice on our trip and got to see 4 of their rooms. As others have said, the staff is nice, although like in other small Parisian hotels you will find the concierge on the phone on a personal call sometimes when you need attention.

On our first stay, we had room 36. It was very small, but the AC was a big plus during a heat wave and it had a separate tub. On our return, we were with my parents and needed two rooms. They gave us the keys to 11 and 13, and then at the last minute suggested we look at 17 and see if we'd rather stay in there. My husband thought we would want to so as not to be right across from my parents, but room 17 was horrible. It looked into the small square opening between buildings (can't call it a courtyard -- it couldn't have been more than 6 feet by 6 feet) and smelled of trash. We immediately rejected it, and I noticed with interest that it was rented later that day. I would definitely not stay in any of the rooms that look out into that space.
reviews.title: Our rooms were just fine, we had a bath and highly recommend
Hotel California St Germain
reviews.text: Our double room was tiny and the bathroom was no bigger than a broom cupboard. We were both pleased that we had come to paris to sight see and did not have to spend any time in the room. The TV was wall mounted and also tiny with minimum volume so we could not even watch the news!! This would suit students on a budget we would not stay there again - it is not for people who are creatures of comfort! On a positive note the shower worked well, the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. It is directly opposite the Sorbonne and there are great local restaurants nearby.

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.text: This is a very good value - we stayed with our teenage daughters. Our room had two beds and enough room for 4 people. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel is updated. I am very particular about cleanliness and this hotel was clean. The staff was a bit snotty - especially the woman working the desk during the day. She and the night clerk were lazy and unhelpful.

I spent 4 nights here in Feb 2006 and would recommend staying here if you can pick up the hotel on one of the discount web sites. My room did look like those in the photos on the website and yes while the bed does take up a lot of the room there were two excellent wardrobes with a personal safe that you activate via any mag strip card of your own eg. a library card or ATM card. The room had a desk and a stand to put your suite case on while you unpacked then I put it into one of the wardrobes. The bathroom do surfice but I can understand while a few people have mentioned problem with the shower recess. It is a generally standard europe shower tray with a curtain across it and although it is wide it is not very deep and can lead you to easily knock the curtain outside of the tray area causing you to wet the floor. Now the staff are all extremely helpful and there was a very delightful lady in particular who was very helpful when looking for particular things to do and see. The only thing that I would like to point out is that getting to the hotel by train can be a little confusing when changing from the RER to the Metro. I interchanged at Saint Michel Notre Dame from the RER and tried to find the platform to get on the Metro 10 line. I had a 20kg suitcase and had to lug it up about 60 stairs as there is no escalator and the walk about another 100-200meters to get onto the the M10 Platform to go to Maubert Mutualite. Now I know I got a little lost doing this... may be I walked further that required - I'm not really sure but it was probably the only issue I has the whole trip. The hotel was able to book an airport car service for 25 Euro for a single person (cheaper if you are a pair)it get me to a very early morning flight and this was great!
reviews.title: Right Price,. Good size rooms and Good Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the California Feb 2-7, 2006. Excellent Latin Quarter Location, the English speaking staff were very helpful with tours, etc. I have read a few of these reviews and can report that we actually did stay in a room as pictured on the internet (green) with a small warning to romantics/couples- the "double bed" is actually two twins pushed together... The breakfast is average if it is included in your hotel fees- otherwise eat elsewhere... awesome little wine bar on the opposite corner "Le Petite Pergoine" with terrific service, great wine selection and cheeses- the waiters MAKE the place! I would stay again if I wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter- but next time we'll stay on the Right Bank. Another tip- the closest metro station "Malbert Mual..." is NOT on a main line- it's much better to walk the extra couple of blocks and use St. Michel Notre Dame as your main metro point.
reviews.title: Location and Service

reviews.text: Nice little hotel in a great location! And it was a great winter value (103 euros/night included a deluxe room with a very nice en suite bath room with shower and wonderful little balcony with french door- view of the Sorbonne and daily basic French breakfast). Would recommend for couples, seniors- not really a "student's hang-out".
reviews.title: Loved Paris
